Race.SpecificTitle: Chief of Police -- City of Central
PW Law Enforcement Dist. -- 3.73 Mills - Sheriff - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Law Enforcement District Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  Continuation of the existing 3.73 mills property tax for a period of ten (10) years for the purpose of providing funds for continued operation of the East Baton Rouge Parish Sheriff's Office.
Race.FullText: Shall the Law Enforcement District of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of three and seventy-three hundredths (3.73) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana (the "Tax") (an estimated $13,797,500.94 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2011, and annually thereafter to and including the year 2020, the proceeds of the said Tax are to be used for operational purposes of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Baton Rouge -- 6 Mills - Metro Council
Race.SummaryText:
City of Baton Rouge Proposition

Summary:  Continuation of the six (6) mills property tax in perpetuity for the purpose of providing funds for salaries and benefits for all employees of the Fire Department of the City of Baton Rouge who are members of the Municipal Fire and Police Civil Service System.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 30 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of six (6) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the City (the "Tax") (an estimated $9,900,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in perpetuity, commencing with the tax collection for the year 2011, and annually thereafter, the proceeds of said Tax to be used entirely and exclusively to provide funds for salaries and benefits for all employees of the Fire Department of the City of Baton Rouge who are members of the Municipal Fire and Police Civil Service System?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 1 -- 9.0 Mills - Metro Council - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 1 Proposition

Summary:  Continuation of the 9.0 mills property tax for a period of five (5) years to provide funds for developing, maintaining and operating the fire protection facilities of the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana.
Race.FullText: Shall the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1501 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of 9.0 mills (the "Tax") (an estimated $283,200 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, for a period of five (5) years, commencing in the year 2011, to and including the year 2015, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Tax, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Zachary -- Home Rule Charter - City Council
Race.SummaryText:
City of Zachary Home Rule Charter Proposition 

Summary:  To Adopt the New Home Rule Charter and Plan of Government for the City of Zachary, prepared and submitted by the duly appointed Charter Commission.
Race.FullText: Do you favor the adoption of the Proposed Home Rule Charter for the City of Zachary?
